intro: Hesperochiron californicus var. incanus, commonly known as the California horseweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive purple-tipped center. It is known for its resilience to drought and its role in supporting local pollinators.
